poem:
**After the Headlines**

In the cold office corridors,  
tangled in bureaucracy,  
hundreds of shadowed lives  
wait silently. Who will count  
the silence of carers,  
whose hands have held  
so many unnoticed days?  
Change calls these walls  
to crumble,  
making space for voices  
unheard, trust unstitched  
but not beyond repair.
